content:
@Taylor Cramer @Josh Triplett @nikomatsakis @pnkfelix

do you have some time this week to look into the FCP in #79135?

(#79135 is still blocked on #79073 which is currently also waiting for a t-lang fcp, though I expect that one to be fairly straightforward)
@lcnr not sure about this week, but I will try! I'm sorry!

@Josh Triplett @nikomatsakis @pnkfelix another quick reminder :sweat_smile:

my goal is to get min_const_generics into the next beta in case there are no concerns. The next cutoff is on the 31.12 so we would have to start the fcp before the 24th afaik
I think rfcbot is having a slow day. The messages on the PR did not do anything, so I tried to check Niko's box manually after the approval, but rfcbot is not reacting
fcp takes 10 days, right? I thin beta is normally promoted a day or two before the release so I would try to get it done by the 19th (which I now realize is awfully soon :flushed:)
hmm strange that rfcbot didn't mark it as a final comment period, maybe it's confused? :confused:
beta is usually promoted on friday before the release

simulacrum said:

beta is usually promoted on friday before the release

as in, 6 days before the release
yes
that's Dec 25th, so if FCP didn't start yet it would be too late.
it started
just the bot doesn't know about it
we can account for it manually
we're fixing the bot now

(or trying to anyway - it might have forgotten this fcp entirely. I think it may make sense to just manually run the final comment period, though technically that still puts us past the likely beta branch point)
Under the assumption there won't be objections in the final day, it could be merged ahead of FCP finishing, and reverted in the very unlikely event there is a last-minute objection?
I am unopposed.
(beyond minor worry over erosion of process and keeping to train model, but ultimately I don't care so much about that, especially as the PR isn't making any changes beyond stabilization afaik)

10 days from now means it'd still be done before the release day, and even before the beta branch date documented on forge <https://forge.rust-lang.org/release/process.html?#promote-master-to-beta-t-2-days-tuesday>, so I don't have train concerns here.
If the last checkbox for FCP came on the 25th I'd probably say that it should wait, but starting today doesn't bother me.
the beta branch happens friday - https://forge.rust-lang.org/release/process.html#bump-the-stable-version-number-t-6-days-friday-the-week-before

given that this is a major feature, I am a bit worried about rushing it in. the entire point of the train model is to not have to do that.
but I am also just a bystander here. ;)
I don't feel a need to rush myself
There's a sizeable percentage of people who think it's already stabilized in .50, myself previously included.
Even if people have an expectation that it comes out in 1.50, it wouldn't be the first feature to slip to a later release. I think people won't be too upset.
i think waiting for 1.51 is probably not too bad even if it's a bit unfortunate
That's a shame, 1.50 was a nice-looking number :upside_down:
well, 1.51 is a palindrome
and prime
though 51 isn't :cry:
And, if it suits your fancy, you can go get some Bacardi 151 to celebrate with...
